title: TodoWebApp MVP
description:
Build a minimal viable todo web application demonstrating core functionality.

## Goals
- Users can create, view, and complete todo items
- Clean, simple interface
- Persistent storage (localStorage for MVP)

## Success Criteria
- User can add a new todo item
- User can mark a todo as complete
- Todos persist across page reloads

## Out of Scope for MVP
- User accounts/authentication
- Cloud sync
- Multiple lists
- Due dates

title: User can manage todos
description:
Users can perform basic todo management operations.

## User Stories
- As a user, I can add a new todo item so I can track what I need to do
- As a user, I can mark a todo as complete so I can track my progress

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Input field accepts text for new todo
- [ ] Pressing Enter or clicking Add creates the todo
- [ ] New todos appear in the list immediately
- [ ] Clicking a todo marks it as complete (visual indicator)
- [ ] Completed todos remain visible but styled differently

## Technical Notes
- Use localStorage for persistence
- Keep state management simple (no external libraries for MVP)

title: Implement add todo item functionality
description:
Implement the ability to add new todo items to the list.

## Requirements
- Input field for entering todo text
- Add button (and Enter key support)
- New todos appear at the bottom of the list
- Input clears after adding
- Empty input should not create a todo

## Implementation Notes
- Create a simple HTML structure: input + button + list
- Use JavaScript to handle form submission
- Store todos in localStorage as JSON array
- Each todo needs: id, text, completed (boolean), createdAt

## Test Specifications

### Unit Tests
- test_add_todo_creates_item_with_correct_structure
- test_add_todo_clears_input_field
- test_add_todo_empty_input_rejected
- test_todos_persist_to_localStorage

### Manual Verification
- Type text and press Enter → todo appears
- Click Add button → todo appears
- Refresh page → todo still visible
- Try adding empty todo → nothing happens

title: Implement mark todo as complete
description:
Implement the ability to mark todo items as complete.

## Requirements
- Clicking a todo toggles its completed state
- Completed todos have visual distinction (strikethrough, muted color)
- Completion state persists in localStorage
- Users can un-complete a todo by clicking again

## Implementation Notes
- Add click handler to todo items
- Toggle completed boolean in todo object
- Update localStorage after each toggle
- Use CSS class for completed styling

## Dependencies
- Requires demo-001.1.1 (add todo functionality) to be complete first
- Builds on the todo data structure and localStorage pattern

## Test Specifications

### Unit Tests
- test_toggle_complete_updates_todo_state
- test_toggle_complete_persists_to_localStorage
- test_toggle_complete_can_uncomplete

### Manual Verification
- Click a todo → it shows as completed
- Click again → it shows as incomplete
- Refresh page → completion state preserved

title: Consider cloud sync for todos
description:
Evaluate cloud sync options for todo persistence across devices.

## Research Topics
- Firebase Realtime Database vs Firestore
- Supabase as open-source alternative
- Conflict resolution strategies for offline-first
- Authentication requirements

## Questions to Answer
- Do we need user accounts?
- How do we handle merge conflicts?
- What's the cost at scale?
- Privacy implications of cloud storage?

## Why This is Parked
This is a significant architectural decision that goes beyond MVP scope. We should validate the core todo functionality before adding complexity.

## When to Revisit
- After MVP is complete and validated
- If users request cross-device sync
- When we have clearer requirements for multi-user support
